abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project would finance
            general imports in support of the Government's Economic
            Recovery Program, set out in its Letter of Recovery Policy,
            designed to reform public finances and economic policies,
            stimulate economic growth and establish conditions from
            which retrogression to the inappropriate policies of the
            past would be difficult. Measures include macroeconomic
            stabilization and the improvement of resource allocation
            through reform of taxes, public expenditure, public
            enterprises, competition and industrial incentives, and
            agricultural pricing and credit. The program is also being
            supported by an arrangement under the International Monetary
            Fund's (IMF) Structural Adjustment Facility.
